Package ma02_resources.project

Interface Project

  • public interface Project
    This interface represents a project in the CBL. Upon creation, @throw an IllegalArgumentException if the name, description or tags are null or the number of participants or tasks is negative or zero.

      • addParticipant

        void addParticipant​(Participant participant)
             throws IllegalNumberOfParticipantType,
                    ParticipantAlreadyInProject
        The method adds a participant to the project.
        Parameters:
        participant - represents a participant in a project.
        Throws:
        IllegalNumberOfParticipantType - if the number of participants of a certain type is already at the maximum.
        ParticipantAlreadyInProject - if the participant is already in the project.

      • removeParticipant

        Participant removeParticipant​(java.lang.String email)
        The method removes a participant from the project.
        Parameters:
        email - represents the email of the participant.
        Returns:
        the participant that was removed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the participant does not exist.

        Participant getParticipant​(java.lang.String email)
        The method "getParticipant" takes a string parameter "email" and returns a Participant object.
        Parameters:
        email - A string representing the email of the participant to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        The method is returning a Participant object with the specified email.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the participant does not exist.

      • hasTag

        boolean hasTag​(java.lang.String tag)
        This method checks if a given tag exists in a list of tags and returns a boolean value accordingly.
        Parameters:
        tag - The parameter "tag" is a String representing the tag that we want to check if it exists in the array of tags.
        Returns:
        A boolean value is being returned, either true or false, depending on whether the input tag is found in the list of tags or not.

      • addTask

        void addTask​(Task task)
      throws IllegalNumberOfTasks,
             TaskAlreadyInProject
        The method adds a task to the project.
        Parameters:
        task - represents a task in a project.
        Throws:
        IllegalNumberOfTasks - if the number of tasks is already at the maximum.
        TaskAlreadyInProject - if the task is already in the project.

      • getTask

        Task getTask​(java.lang.String title)
        The method "getTask" takes a string parameter "title" and returns a Task object.
        Parameters:
        title - A string representing the title of the task to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        The method is returning a Task object with the specified title.

      • getTasks

        Task[] getTasks()
        The method "getTasks()" returns an array of Task objects.
        Returns:
        An array of Task objects is being returned.

      • isCompleted

        boolean isCompleted()
        The method checks if all tasks have at least one submission.
        Returns:
        The method isCompleted() returns a boolean value. It returns true if all tasks have at least one submission, and false otherwise. If the number of tasks inserted is not equal to the number specified upon creation it must return false.

      • equals

        boolean equals​(java.lang.Object o)
        This is an implementation of the equals() method in Java that checks if two Project objects are equal based on their name attribute.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        o - The parameter "o" is an object of type Object, which is the superclass of all other classes in Java. It is used to compare the equality of two Project objects.
        Returns:
        The method is returning a boolean value, either true or false.
